001/**
002 * Class Beamer - Represents a teleportation device in the game.
003 *
004 * It can be charged with a specific room and later fired to teleport
005 * the player back to the charged room. A beamer can be recharged after use.
006 *
007 * The Beamer class extends the {@link Item} class to integrate with the game's item system.
008 * 
009 * @author Florian NELCHA
010 */
011public class Beamer extends Item 
012{
013    // ### Attributes ###
014    
015    private Room aChargedRoom;
016    private boolean aIsCharged;
017    
018    // ### Constructor ###
019    
020    /**
021     * Constructs a new unloaded Beamer with all the attributes of its super class, .
022     * 
023     * @param pN The name of the Beamer.
024     * @param pD The description of the Beamer.
025     * @param pW The weight of the Beamer.
026     */
027    public Beamer(final String pN, final String pD, final double pW)
028    {
029        super(pN,pD,pW);
030        this.aIsCharged = false;        
031    }
032    
033    // ### Other Methods ###
034    
035    /**
036     * Charges the beamer with the given room.
037     * @param pR The room to charge the beamer with.
038     */
039    public void charge(final Room pR) 
040    {
041        this.aChargedRoom = pR;
042        this.aIsCharged = true;
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Fires the beamer, returning the charged room.
047     * @return The room the beamer is charged with, or null if not charged.
048     */
049    public Room fire() 
050    {
051        if (!this.aIsCharged) 
052        {
053            return null;
054        }
055        Room vTeleportRoom = this.aChargedRoom;
056        this.aChargedRoom = null;
057        this.aIsCharged = false;
058        return vTeleportRoom;
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Checks if the beamer is charged.
063     * @return True if charged, false otherwise.
064     */
065    public boolean isCharged()
066    {
067        return this.aIsCharged;
068    }
069}
